page.title: 01PRINCIPLE FEATURES
page.content: The Main feature in our 'D' block is the A1 or the Great North Road which runs in a north south direction on the map.It is the main road linking London to Edingburgh. There are other important transport routes,including the Ermine Street ( A Roman road) and the main London to Edingburgh railway line.The river Witham also flows through this area in its infant stage. The 'D' block area is predominantly rural with two small villages (Great and Little Ponton) and scattered farms.Most of the land is used for arable farming ,although there are several dairy herds in the Witham valley.There are also several areas of woodland mainly made up of deciduous trees although Boothby Great Wood has a managed coniferous plantation.
